thread.title: Your 401(k) Is Too Important Not To Understand
thread.title_full: Your 401(k) Is Too Important Not To Understand

title: Your 401(k) Is Too Important Not To Understand
text:
Your 401(k) Is Too Important Not To Understand Written by: Jason Notte 09/01/15 - 11:27 AM EDT 
NEW YORK ( MainStreet ) â€“ Your 401(k) is likely the bulk of your retirement plan ... and it's scaring you to death. 
Schwab Retirement Plan Services recently conducted a nationwide survey of 1,000 401(k) plan participants and discovered that 59% say their 401(k) is their only or largest source of retirement savings . Roughly 91% of participants surveyed receive a company match and 87% of those who do contribute enough to get the full company match. With that in mind, 90% of respondents said they would think twice about taking a job if the company did not offer a 401(k) plan. 
Granted, that doesn't mean they know what one is or what they're doing with it -- especially the 25% taking loans from their 401(k) either to pay for houses or cover bills -- but why let those little details ruin a good time? More Headlines
